entry.title: RESOLVED: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Meet. We will provide more information shortly. The affected users are able to access Google Meet, but are seeing error messages, high latency, and/or other unexpected behavior.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2022-12-13 05:30 and ended at 2022-12-13 17:50 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Incident Report

Summary

On Monday, 12 December 2022 at 21:30 US/Pacific, some Google Meet users experienced issues joining livestreams globally for a duration of 12 hours and 20 minutes. The issue did not impact iOS users of Meet. To our Google Workspace customers who were impacted during this disruption, we sincerely apologize. This is not the level of quality and reliability we strive to offer you, and we have conducted an internal investigation and are taking immediate steps to improve the resiliency of our service.

Root Cause

Google Meet livestream allows Meet customers to stream meetings to a large number of viewers. It relies on the YouTube streaming infrastructure and the YouTube player to view livestreams in the browser.

The trigger of the incident was a recent software update, which introduced an issue that resulted in the video player failing to recognize Meet livestreams and failing to start live playbacks. The change was initially pushed to 1% of users, and after monitoring for a period of time with no issues observed, Google engineers followed established practices and pushed the change to 100% of users in production.

Errors that occurred during this period, however, were missed during the initial rollout, because our monitoring did not properly incorporate signals from Meet's player. Once the change was pushed to 100%, the issue's frequency increased. The errors that occurred due to the change also led to additional internal API traffic due to retry behaviors, which overloaded our servers.

Remediation and Prevention

Google engineers were notified of the issue through a customer support case on Tuesday, 13 December at 03:12 US/Pacific and immediately began an investigation. Once the scope of the issue became clear, the incident was escalated at 04:53. The incident was further escalated to the YouTube team at 07:44. At 09:20, the root cause was identified, and engineers initiated a rollback of the software update. The incident was fully mitigated at 09:50, once the rollback completed.

Google is committed preventing a repeat of this issue in the future and is completing the following actions:

  • Implement a fix for the video player retry loop in the Meet player to prevent request overload.
  • Implement monitoring and alerting to detect failures to connect to livestreams in Meet and reduce mitigation time for issues of this type.
  • Investigate an alternative live streaming platform for Meet and remove dependency on YouTube.
  • Enhance testing in the staging environment to identify and prevent regressions before rollout progresses.

Detailed Description of Impact

On Monday, 12 December 2022 from 21:30 to Tuesday, 13 December at 09:50 PT, some Google Meet users experienced issues joining livestreams globally.

Google Meet

  • Android and Web Google Meet clients experienced errors, which resulted in a retry loop behavior for the Meet broadcast players.
  • Some users would continue to see the error after the rollback completed, as a browser refresh would be required.

Affected products: Google Meet

entry.title: Incident: Messages on iOS are automatically marked as read
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From Monday December 12, 2022 at 10:27 AM PST to Monday December 19, 2022 at 1:30 PM PST, we began investigating reports of messages being marked as read when backgrounding the iOS app while in a conversation. As a result, the sidebar would not show unread messages next to the DM/Channel/Threads view.
We have now made a change on our end that resolved the issue and released a fix on iOS app version 22.12.21. Users on the iOS app should now be able to receive messages without them being marked as read automatically.

entry.title: Incident: Some users having trouble playing videos
entry.summary:
Issue summary: From December 13, 2022 at 11:46 AM PST to December 14, 2022 at 7:30 AM PST some customers may have experienced issues while playing videos.
We determined this issue was caused by a recent frontend change that caused a failure to load videos via the streaming protocol HLS (Hypertext Live Streaming), for which no fallback existed.
To resolve this issue, we introduced a fallback to HLS allowing users to play video files with a slightly degraded experience, such as longer load times.
Additionally, we disabled a code optimization technique which fully restored HLS functionality for all users.

entry.title: Incident: Some users not receiving 2FA codes via SMS
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From December 14, 2022 at 04:30 PST to December 14, 2022 at 09:00 PST, we received reports from customers who were unable to receive SMS 2FA codes to login, we discovered that the Slack Twilio queue on the Twilio services was growing at a high rate and the outgoing SMS message error rate began to grow. Customers who had enabled 2FA via SMS were affected in at least India, China, US, Brazil, and Argentina. It was discovered that a majority of this traffic was coming from nefarious acting workspaces issuing too many app download link SMS requests to the Twilio service. With thousands of workspaces doing this at the same time, our queue became overloaded. The disposable email domains used to create these teams were added to a Total Ban blocklist preventing any users using the domains from accessing Slack â€” stopping team creation and further SMS pumping. Twilio was also able to drop the messages specific to app download links based on a content filter. With these actions, the queue was able to catch back up.

entry.title: Incident: Trouble connecting in Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From 10:12 AM PST until 10:25 AM PST on December 14, 2022, some customers had trouble loading Slack workspaces, sending messages, and uploading files.
Prior to this issue, we began removing traffic from an isolated location within a data center region as part of a planned exercise. Upon further investigation, we identified a bug within this process. We then stopped the process, which resolved the issue for all users. Error rates were monitored for a short while prior to announcing the resolution, in order to ensure the issue was fully resolved and would not reoccur.

entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From December 8, 2022 at 03:15 PST to December 8, 2022 at 05:10 PST, some customers may have experienced issues with exports failing. This was due to a lack of disk space on one of the hosts running export jobs. We fixed this issue by terminating the host which resolved the problem for all affected customers.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues loading DMs or channels
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From December 1, 2022 at 12:10 PM PST to December 5, 2022 at 2:43 PM PST, some customers may have experienced issues with blank channels and direct message conversations.
We made a small change to improve the screen reader experience that inadvertently introduced a syntax error. We corrected this error, resolving the problem for all affected customers.

entry.title: Incident with Git Operations and Pull Requests
entry.summary: Dec 5, 18:40 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Dec 5, 18:07 UTC Update - We have identified possible causes slowing down git operations including push and pull for a small number of customers, as well as some slow merge operations and are working on mitigating now. Dec 5, 17:31 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Git Operations and Pull Requests.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers may be experiencing issues with custom emoji reactions disappearing
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From December 1, 2022, 1:00 PM PST, to December 1, 2022, 6:30 PM PST, some of our users ran into an issue where custom emoji containing non-ASCII characters disappeared after being used as reactions.
A backend change to our emoji validation process caused some emojis with non-ASCII characters to be rejected.
Your emoji reactions should now be back to normal.

entry.title: Incident: Issues with SMS two-factor authentication for some customers
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On December 4, 2022, from 5:00 PM PST to 11:14 PM, users ran into trouble where they did not receive 2FA codes on SMS, making them unable to log into Slack as a result. This issue was due to a service provider's slow processing rate.
To fix this, we sorted out the processing backlog together with the service provider. We then had them raise the country specific processing rate limit, resolving the issue for our customers.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing connectivity issues.
entry.summary:
On Tuesday November 29th from 10:32am PST to 2:07pm PST, customers in some regions began noticing connection issue with Slack.
An automation from an upstream DNS service accidentally blocked slack.com queries in a limited region (mostly the Northeast US).
After communication with the upstream provider, the issue was identified and corrected. Impacted users should have no further issues connecting to Slack.

entry.title: New feature - Automated discount codes by Smily!
entry.summary: New! Â Â As we all know, retaining guests and providing them an incentive to book directly with you, or rewarding their loyalty, is key. The current non-automated solutions are time-consuming and require a lot of effort from you and your guests. After several workshops with Smily users, reflections, and feedback, our Smily team designed an elegant and flexible solution to meet your various needs. Say hello to our new functionality: â€œDiscount codesâ€ A powerful marketing tool that allows you to create customized discounts. with different values for all rentals, or specific ones! How can I use this feature? In a few easy steps explained in our demo video: Watch the video For more details please follow the steps in the link below: Read the article Still have some availability on your calendar? ðŸŽ Give your previous guests a nice Christmas gift and send them a discount code to book their next trip with you during the low season. ðŸ’¡For guests who book on the channels, offer them a special discount after their stay if they book on your website for their next trip. ðŸ˜Ž Offer a discount to all the guests who booked with you as a reward to use personally or to share with their family or friends. With the new Smily discount code you will save time and book even more! Wishing you all a pleasant day! Smily Team

entry.title: Incident: Issues with search in Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From November 23, 2022 at 7:30pm PST to November 23, 2022 at 8:22pm PST, some users were unable to send messages, load content or use workflows within Slack. We discovered the issue was related to a recent change which accidentally severed access to a number of endpoints. A network change was made and most services started to auto-recover and work again.
During the restore process some users experienced search errors or slow responses within the search bar. This was resolved on November 24, 2022 at 5:58pm PST, restoring functionality for all affected users.
